Assemble tibble from matrix of log-likelihood values

Source: R/tidy_scan_pvl.R
transform_loglik_mat.Rd

Assemble tibble from matrix of log-likelihood values

transform_loglik_mat(loglik_mat)

Arguments

loglik_mat

a square matrix of log-likelihood values with rownames and colnames matching

Value

tibble with 3 columns: marker1, marker2 and log-likelihood

See also

Other profile log-likelihood tibble functions: add_intercepts, add_pmap, assemble_profile_tib, tidy_scan_pvl

Examples

llmat <- matrix(nrow = 3, ncol = 3, data = rgamma(9, 5))
rownames(llmat) <- paste0('m', 1:3)
colnames(llmat) <- paste0('m', 1:3)
transform_loglik_mat(llmat)
#> [90m# A tibble: 9 x 3[39m
#>   marker1 marker2    ll
#>   [3m[90m<chr>[39m[23m   [3m[90m<chr>[39m[23m   [3m[90m<dbl>[39m[23m
#> [90m1[39m m1      m1       2.41
#> [90m2[39m m2      m1       3.01
#> [90m3[39m m3      m1       8.85
#> [90m4[39m m1      m2      11.7 
#> [90m5[39m m2      m2       5.08
#> [90m6[39m m3      m2       4.35
#> [90m7[39m m1      m3       3.16
#> [90m8[39m m2      m3       3.71
#> [90m9[39m m3      m3       4.87
